definition: to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: Bart really cleaned up in the card game.
sentences.chinese: 巴特在紙牌有戲中大獲全勝。

sentences.english: Pat was concerned winning it all would make us too comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 帕特擔心大獲全勝會使我們太過愜意放鬆。

sentences.english: After doing this for several months, I scored a date with one of them.
sentences.chinese: 連續幹了幾個月，我終於大獲全勝，跟一個男生約會。

sentences.english: Mahathir. Pakatan Rakyat candidates, as expected, emerged triumphant and completely unscathed .
sentences.chinese: 一如所料，民聯候選人大獲全勝。

sentences.english: They're looking for a walk-off grand slam when the game has just begun.
sentences.chinese: 他們總希望比賽一開場就能大獲全勝。

sentences.english: Speeding off in a stolen car, the thief thinks he has got a great catch.
sentences.chinese: 超速駕駛在偷來的汽車裏，偷車賊以爲自己大獲全勝。

sentences.english: We played mah-jong last night and I swept the board.
sentences.chinese: 我們昨夜打麻將牌，我大獲全勝。

sentences.english: Indeed, Buffett can win the game before ever stepping up to bat.
sentences.chinese: 的確，巴菲特不費吹灰之力就能在交易中大獲全勝。

sentences.english: By contrast, Senator Dole won big.
sentences.chinese: 相反，多爾參議員大獲全勝。

sentences.english: Some people thought after winning it all last year you'd put on a few more pounds in the off-season .
sentences.chinese: 有些人覺得在去年大獲全勝之後你在休賽期又養膘了。

definition: peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
to charge and break through enemy lines
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
